title: Sam Kerr reveals next steps after winning  Icon  of the year at Marie Claire Awards
body_text:
Sam Kerr reveals next steps after winning ‘Icon’ of the year at Marie Claire Awards
Sam Kerr says she plans to use her new “icon” status to build on Matildas-mania that engulfed the nation during the World Cup.
Perth’s soccer superstar put on a glamour turn for Marie Claire magazine as she was named ‘Icon of the Year’ at last night’s Marie Claire Women of the Year Awards 2023 in Sydney.
Her teammates also shared the spoils landing the Champions of the Year prize after their semi-final run inspired a nation and heightened interest in women’s sports.
Kerr said the highlight was hearing the cheers of her home city in WA.
“We obviously went into the World Cup not wanting to come fourth – we would have loved to have gone further,” the 30-year-old said before winning the gong.
“But what we created off the pitch was even bigger. We’ve just had a chance to come back to Australia and play the Olympic qualifiers in Perth, and to see sell-out crowds in my hometown was epic.”
The Chelsea player also became engaged to US player Kristie Mewis during the year but told how the action on the pitch was the highlight for her.
“Playing to packed stadiums around the country, in front of family and friends, while having the whole country support and get behind us was the highlight of 2023 for me,” she said.
Now the hometown hero said her focus is on finding the next generation of Matildas.
Taking matters into her own hands, she said: “We are already seeing changes with funding being announced, which means better facilities and more opportunities for young girls to play the sport. I’ve also launched my own football schools, Sam Kerr Football, which will be starting early next year. SKF will hopefully inspire the next generation of kids and give young players the best chance to live out their potential on the pitch and to fall in love with the beautiful game.”
With the Paris Olympics in her sights, she said on her World Cup heroics, “It was a surreal time and something I will remember for the rest of my life.”
Fellow teammate Mary Fowler posed on the magazine’s cover for the prestigious awards. Fowler, 20, has seen her profile shoot through the roof both because of her on-pitch heroics and her high-profile romance with NRL star Nathan Cleary.
Other WA winners inside Sydney’s Foundation Hall, Museum of Contemporary Art included singer Amy Manford, who won Creative of the Year and Tin Turner Musical star Ruva Nywenga, who won Rising Star of the Year.
Pop’s comeback queen Kylie Minogue won Entertainer of the Year, chosen by a panel of judges that included Grace Tame, Jessica Mauboy, Teresa Palmer, Janice Peterson, Kylie Kwong, Christine Holgate, Sarah Harden, Jane Huxley and Georgie Abay.
Full list of winners at the 2023 Marie Claire Women of the Year Awards:
- Champions of the Year: The Matildas
- Icon of the Year: Sam Kerr
- Entertainer of the Year: Kylie Minogue
- Eco Warrior of the Year: Lottie Dalziel
- Voice of Now: Chanel Contos and Maria Thattil (joint)
- Powerhouse of the Year: Prof. Megan Davis
- Advocate of the Year: Hannah Diviney
- Designer of the Year: Rebecca Vallance
- Rising Star of the Year: Ruva Nywenga
- Changemaker of the Year: Jess Hill
- Creative of the Year: Amy Manford and Made Up Stories (joint)
